{"step_by_step_thinking": "Atopic dermatitis is a condition that affects the skin, making it dry and itchy. It also disrupts the skin's barrier function, making it easier for bacteria and viruses to penetrate. Impetigo, molluscum, and herpes are all infections that can take advantage of this weakened barrier. Therefore, it is logical to assume that children with atopic dermatitis would have an increased lifetime prevalence of these infections.", "answer_choice": "A"}
